faqs.title: SlimeVR server setup

faqs.answer: As of July 19th, 2024, any new orders placed are estimated to ship on **September 29th, 2024** (this provided date is subject to change, please check the [CrowdSupply page](https://www.crowdsupply.com/slimevr/slimevr-full-body-tracker#products) for the latest information). faqs.title: Using 3 trackers with SlimeVR
faqs.answer: Using only 3 trackers is not recommended, you won't be able to bend your legs (commonly referred to as "Minecraft" legs). You can see a demonstration of different combinations of trackers in ZRock's video at https://youtu.be/iKmrNKLacwk. You can find more information about how many trackers you need at https://docs.slimevr.dev/slimevr101.html#how-many-trackers-do-you-need.

faqs.title: Amazon trackers
faqs.answer: **__Don't__** buy trackers from Amazon. Buying trackers from Amazon is not recommended as there have been many reports of faulty trackers from Amazon. You can find more information in the [#amazon-trackers](https://discord.com/channels/817184208525983775/986713204656857138) channel on the [SlimeVR Discord](https://discord.gg/SlimeVR).

faqs.title: Amazon trackers issues with serial console
faqs.answer: If you're having trouble connecting your trackers with the serial console, you may have unofficial trackers from Amazon. If so, it's recommended that you just return them, otherwise if you really want to try to make them work, you can check in the [#amazon-trackers](https://discord.com/channels/817184208525983775/986713204656857138) channel on the [SlimeVR Discord](https://discord.gg/SlimeVR) for more information.

faqs.title: SlimeVR on VRChat standalone
faqs.answer: SlimeVR running on standalone Quest, Pico, and Android is in early works with support for VRChat's OSC tracker protocol, you can find more information at https://docs.slimevr.dev/tools/mobile-installation.html, https://docs.slimevr.dev/server/osc-information.html, and in the [#vrchat-osctrackers](https://discord.com/channels/817184208525983775/1045451713357819915) channel on the [SlimeVR Discord](https://discord.gg/SlimeVR). For legacy use, you can find information on Termux at https://docs.slimevr.dev/tools/termux-installation.html, but it is recommended to use the native app instead.

faqs.title: Config and log locations
faqs.answer: The app data for the SlimeVR server is located at "%AppData%\dev.slimevr.SlimeVR" as of v0.9.0. The main config file is "vrconfig.yml". The logs are stored in the "logs" folder, where "log_last_X.log" are server logs and "slimevr_rX.log" are GUI logs.

faqs.title: Official Trackers - Blue Light of Death (BLOD)
faqs.answer: Symptoms of this hardware issue that may occur on some of the **official** trackers include solid blue light (not blinking), suddenly stopped working, or suddenly stopped connecting to WiFi/SlimeVR server. To get a warranty replacement, fill out the form at https://slimevr.dev/support.

faqs.title: Debugging tracker errors
faqs.answer: To debug a tracker error, you'll need to get the serial logs. To get the serial logs: Open the "Settings" tab of the GUI, open the serial console under the "Utilities" section, plug the tracker in via USB, press the "Reboot" button, and you should see output show up. If you don't see the output, you can also try pressing the reset button on your tracker if available.

faqs.title: Why did CrowdSupply push back my order?
faqs.answer: CrowdSupply provides an estimate for when your order will ship, this estimate may change to more accurately reflect the current conditions. The CrowdSupply dates aren't updated frequently and usually the SlimeVR Discord will have information earlier through updates. For the latest information on shipping and production progress, you can check the [#shipping-progress](https://discord.com/channels/817184208525983775/1129107343058153623) and [#updates](https://discord.com/channels/817184208525983775/818062236492759050) channels on the [SlimeVR Discord](https://discord.gg/SlimeVR).

faqs.title: Official Trackers - Broken/Missing Extension Tracker(s)
faqs.answer: If you can't find your extension trackers in the box, check the section with the straps as it could be hidden underneath. To get warranty replacement extension trackers for your **official** tracker set, fill out the form at https://slimevr.dev/support. If these are DIY trackers, you can find information at https://docs.slimevr.dev/common-issues.html#my-aux-tracker-isnt-working.

faqs.title: SlimeVR GUI repeatedly timing out
faqs.answer: If your SlimeVR GUI is repeatedly timing out from the SlimeVR server (check the logs), you may be able to fix this by running the following command in an administrator console: `netsh int tcp set supplemental internet congestionprovider=default`
matched_questions: Connection lost to the server. Trying to reconnect...

faqs.title: Official Trackers - Charging your trackers
faqs.answer: When charging your trackers, a red light will indicate that the battery is charging, a green light will indicate when the tracker is fully charged. It should take approximately 2.5 hours to fully charge from 0% to 100%. The battery percentage reported while the tracker is charging is not accurate and will always report 100%, you should rely on the red and green indicator lights instead.

faqs.title: Trackers only turn on when plugged in
faqs.answer: If your trackers are only turning on when plugged in or turning off quickly after unplugging, the trackers may be out of battery and need to charge. Try letting the tracker charge for at least 10 minutes or until the charging light is green. If the tracker still doesn't work while unplugged, there may be an issue with the battery.
